item.title: Scale images using python script
item.description: For scaling jpeg image files in bulk, there is a python script from this link. http://united-coders.com/christian-harms/image-resizing-tips-every-coder-should-know/ import Image, os, sys for filename in sys.argv[1:]: img = Image.open(filename).resize( (200,200) ) out = file(os.path.splitext(filename)[0]+"_thumb.jpg", "w") try: img.save(out, "JPEG") finally: out.close() It is only some eight lines of code, but doing a tremendous job. Another essential thing to learn is the use of finding and regex to feed the files into a python script.
